entry.title: address
entry.summary: The address-field contains the publisher's (or any other institution) address.

entry.title: annote
entry.summary: BibTeX Field type

entry.title: author
entry.summary: In the `author`-field, you can specify all contributors to the work you want to cite. BibTeX has several ways of specifying author names but expects in all cases a consistent and exact arrangement so that inaccurate information could lead to the unwanted output of the author's name.

entry.title: booktitle
entry.summary: To cite an `incollection, i.e., a part of a book/collection with its own title, or to give a title to an article, part of an inproceedings, the booktitle-field is used to distinguish. At the same time, title contains the title of the book, or incproceedings`.

entry.title: chapter
entry.summary: chapter

entry.title: crossref
entry.summary: Coming soon ...

entry.title: doi
entry.summary: `doi is used to store any DOI (Digital Object Identifier of the International DOI Foundation). DOI is a digital identifier that is intended to be permanent and unique. It is used, among other things, and mostly for articles from scientific journals. It can be used in article, but more rarely also in chapter, book, or inproceedings / conference`. This field is optional in all cases.

entry.title: edition
entry.summary: The edition of a book, e.g. "edition = " Entering an ordinal number is recommended by default, and the first letter is usually capitalised.

entry.title: editor
entry.summary: In the `editor`-field, you can specify all editors to the work you want to cite. BibTeX has several ways of specifying editor names but expects in all cases a consistent and exact arrangement so that inaccurate information could lead to the unwanted output of the editor's name.

entry.title: email
entry.summary: Email includes the email address of the stated authors if you want to indicate them. It's not a common field and might not be supported.

entry.title: howpublished
entry.summary: Coming soon ...

entry.title: institution
entry.summary: Coming soon ...

entry.title: journal
entry.summary: The name of the journal in which the paper was published

entry.title: key
entry.summary: Coming soon ...

entry.title: month
entry.summary: The month of publication, or creation if unpublished.

entry.title: note
entry.summary: The notes field can be used to store additional information about a particular BibTeX entry that may be relevant to the reader or that is needed for a particular entry type and citation style but does not fit in any other field.

entry.title: number
entry.summary: Coming soon ...

entry.title: organization
entry.summary: Coming soon ...

entry.title: pages
entry.summary: Coming soon ...

entry.title: publisher
entry.summary: Coming soon ...

entry.title: school
entry.summary: Coming soon ...

entry.title: series
entry.summary: Coming soon ...

entry.title: title
entry.summary: The title field is saved for the title of a work to be cited. LaTeX-specific writing, such as capitalisation, should be taken into account.

entry.title: type
entry.summary: Within the BibTeX entry, the type field is used to declare an explicit type, i.e. for technical report "Research Note", or "Government Report".

entry.title: volume
entry.summary: The 'volume' field is used to enter the volume of a journal or multi-volume book.

entry.title: year
entry.summary: The year of publication, or creation if unpublished.
